chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
UnitalSeparationAlgebra unit

Premises:
UnitalSeparationAlgebra : forall worlds : Type, Relation worlds -> Join worlds -> Prop
Build_UnitalSeparationAlgebra : forall (worlds : Type) (R : Relation worlds) (J : Join worlds), (forall n : worlds, exists m : worlds, residue n m /\ increasing m) -> UnitalSeparationAlgebra worlds
incr_exists : forall n : ?worlds, exists m : ?worlds, residue n m /\ increasing m where ?worlds : [ |- Type] ?R : [ |- Relation ?worlds] ?J : [ |- Join ?worlds] ?UnitalSeparationAlgebra : [ |- UnitalSeparationAlgebra ?worlds]
unital_is_residual = fun (worlds : Type) (R : Relation worlds) (_ : PreOrder Krelation) (J : Join worlds) (H : UnitalSeparationAlgebra worlds) => {| residue_exists := fun n : worlds => let e : exists m : worlds, residue n m /\ increasing m := incr_exists n in match e with | ex_intro _ m (conj RES _) => ex_intro (fun m0 : worlds => residue n m0) m RES end |} : forall (worlds : Type) (R : Relation worlds), PreOrder Krelation -> forall J : Join worlds, UnitalSeparationAlgebra worlds -> ResidualSeparationAlgebra worlds Arguments worlds, R, po_R, J are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ _ _]
Inductive unit : Set := tt : unit
unit_Join = fun _ _ _ : unit => True : Join unit
unit_residual = {| residue_exists := fun n : unit => ex_intro (fun m : unit => residue n m) tt (ex_intro (fun n' : unit => join tt n' n /\ Krelation n n') tt (conj I match n as u return (Krelation u tt) with | tt => reflexivity tt end)) |} : ResidualSeparationAlgebra unit
ssrfun.unitE = fun __top_assumption_ : unit => (fun _evar_0_ : (fun u : unit => (let flex := u in flex) = tt) tt => match __top_assumption_ as u return ((fun u0 : unit => (let flex := u0 in flex) = tt) u) with | tt => _evar_0_ end) eq_refl : ssrfun.all_equal_to tt
ssreflect.abstract_key = tt : unit
ssreflect.master_key = tt : unit
ssreflect.abstract_lock = unit : Set
Base.unit_MD = {| Base.model := unit |} : Base.Model
ssreflect.NonPropType.Test : forall result : bool, unit -> ssreflect.NonPropType.test_of result
ssreflect.NonPropType.condition : forall result : bool, ssreflect.NonPropType.test_of result -> unit
ssreflect.locked_with : unit -> forall x : Type, x -> x
ssreflect.locked_with_unlockable : forall T : Type, unit -> forall x : T, ssreflect.unlockable x
ssreflect.NonPropType.maybeProp = fun _ : Type => tt : Type -> unit Argument scope is [type_scope]
unit_ind : forall P : unit -> Prop, P tt -> forall u : unit, P u
unit_sind : forall P : unit -> SProp, P tt -> forall u : unit, P u
unit_rect : forall P : unit -> Type, P tt -> forall u : unit, P u
unit_rec : forall P : unit -> Set, P tt -> forall u : unit, P u
unit_SA = {| join_comm := fun (m1 m2 m : unit) (_ : join m1 m2 m) => I; join_assoc := fun (mx my mz mxy mxyz : unit) (_ : join mx my mxy) (_ : join mxy mz mxyz) => ex_intro (fun myz : unit => join my mz myz /\ join mx myz mxyz) tt (conj I I) |} : SeparationAlgebra unit
incr_unital_iff_residual = fun (worlds : Type) (R : Relation worlds) (po_R : PreOrder Krelation) (J : Join worlds) (H : IncreasingSeparationAlgebra worlds) => conj unital_is_residual (fun H0 : ResidualSeparationAlgebra worlds => {| incr_exists := fun n : worlds => let e : exists m : worlds, residue n m := residue_exists n in match e with | ex_intro _ m RES => ex_intro (fun m0 : worlds => residue n m0 /\ increasing m0) m (conj RES (all_increasing m)) end |}) : forall (worlds : Type) (R : Relation worlds), PreOrder Krelation -> forall J : Join worlds, IncreasingSeparationAlgebra worlds -> UnitalSeparationAlgebra worlds < -> ResidualSeparationAlgebra worlds Arguments worlds, R, po_R, J are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _ _ _]
unit_uSA = fun (m n m1 m2 : unit) (H : join m1 m2 m) (_ : Krelation m n) => ex_intro (fun n1 : unit => exists n2 : unit, join n1 n2 n /\ Krelation m1 n1 /\ Krelation m2 n2) tt (ex_intro (fun n2 : unit => join tt n2 n /\ Krelation m1 tt /\ Krelation m2 n2) tt (conj H (conj (match m1 as u return (join u m2 m -> Krelation u tt) with | tt => fun _ : join tt m2 m => reflexivity tt end H) (match m2 as u return (join m1 u m -> Krelation u tt) with | tt => fun _ : join m1 tt m => reflexivity tt end H)))) : UpwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra unit
unit_dSA = fun (m1 m2 m n1 n2 : unit) (H : join m1 m2 m) (_ : Krelation n1 m1) (_ : Krelation n2 m2) => ex_intro (fun n : unit => join n1 n2 n /\ Krelation n m) tt (conj H (match m as u return (join m1 m2 u -> Krelation tt u) with | tt => fun _ : join m1 m2 tt => reflexivity tt end H)) : DownwardsClosedSeparationAlgebra unit
Record test_of (result : bool) : Set := Test { condition : unit } For test_of: Argument scope is [bool_scope] For Test: Argument scopes are [bool_scope _]
unit_incrSA = {| all_increasing := fun (x n n' : unit) (H : join x n n') => match n as u return (join x u n' -> Krelation u n') with | tt => fun H0 : join x tt n' => match n' as u return (join x tt u -> Krelation tt u) with | tt => fun _ : join x tt tt => reflexivity tt end H0 end H |} : IncreasingSeparationAlgebra unit
FSetPositive.PositiveSet.mem = fix mem (i : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.elt) (m : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.t) {struct m} : bool := match m with | FSetPositive.PositiveSet.Leaf => false | FSetPositive.PositiveSet.Node l o r => match i with | BinNums.xI i0 => mem i0 r | BinNums.xO i0 => mem i0 l | BinNums.xH => o end end : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.elt -> FSetPositive.PositiveSet.t -> bool
BinInt.Z.divide_0_l : forall n : BinNums.Z, BinInt.Z.divide BinNums.Z0 n -> n = BinNums.Z0
lt = fun n m : nat => S n <= m : nat -> nat -> Prop Argument scopes are [nat_scope nat_scope]
ZMicromega.agree_env_eval_bf : forall (env env' : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.Z) (f : Tauto.GFormula), ZMicromega.agree_env (ZMicromega.vars_of_bformula f) env env' -> Tauto.eval_bf (ZMicromega.Zeval_formula env') f < -> Tauto.eval_bf (ZMicromega.Zeval_formula env) f
